article.headline: Coll. of Charleston 70, Wofford 60
article.story: CHARLESTON, S.C. (AP) -- Jermaine Johnson scored 17 points and had 12 rebounds to lead the College of Charleston to a 70-60 win over Wofford on Thursday night. The Terriers (8-8, 1-5 Southern Conference) scored the first three points of the second half to tie the game at 33, but the Cougars (9-8, 4-3) went on a 13-4 run to take a 46-37 lead. Wofford's Shane Nichols cut the lead to seven a couple of times in the final five minutes, but Johnson hit all four of his free throws in the final 55 seconds to secure the win. Charleston shot 52.9 percent (27-of-51) from the field, while Wofford shot 38.8 percent (19-of-49). The Cougars also had a 37-23 advantage on the boards. Nichols led Wofford with 19 points, while Drew Gibson added seven points and six assists. Andrew Goudelock scored 16 points and Antwaine Wiggins added 10 points and 10 rebounds for Charleston.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
